tool.name: RUSLEAccounts
tool.displayname: Calculate soil loss accounts using different factor layers

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: YearA_ScenarioFolder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder where the output from the Preprocess data tool is stored for the first year/scenario.

param.name: YearB_ScenarioFolder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder where the output from the Preprocess data tool is stored for the second year/scenario.

param.name: LS_option
param.expression: Calculate based on slope and length only | Include upslope contributing area
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options to estimate the effect of slope length and steepness:

  • Calculate based on slope and length only: This method only accounts for slope length and steepness as specified by Morgan [1].

  • Include upslope contributing area: This method includes slope length, steepness, and upslope contributing area as specified by Desmet & Govers [2] and Mitasova et al. [3]. This method may require more processing time if the study area is large or the DEM is high-resolution.

Default is Calculate based on slope and length only.

[1] Morgan, R. P. C. (2005) Soil Erosion and Conservation. National Soil Resources Institute, Cranfield University.

[2] Desmet, P. J. J. & Govers, G. (1996) A GIS procedure for automatically calculating the USLE LS factor on topographically complex landscape units. Journal of Soil and Water Conservation, 51, 427-433.

[3] Mitasova, H., Barton, M., Ullah, I., Hofierka, J. & Harmon, R. (2013). GIS-Based Soil Erosion Modeling, in: Treatise on Geomorphology, 3, 228-258, Academic Press, San Diego, California.

param.name: Rainfall_erosivity
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the rainfall erosivity raster.

param.name: Erodibility_dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input K-factor raster, shapefile, or feature class.

param.name: Soil_linking_code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input K-factor dataset. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Land_cover_A
param.displayname: C-factor for Year A: Land cover factor dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input C-factor raster, shapefile, or feature class for the first/opening year.

param.name: Land_cover_linking_code_A
param.displayname: C-factor for Year A: Land cover linking code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input cover factor dataset for the opening year. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Land_cover_B
param.displayname: C-factor for Year B: Land cover or cover factor dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename of the input C-factor raster, shapefile, or feature class for the second/closing year.

param.name: Land_cover_linking_code_B
param.displayname: C-factor for Year B: Land cover linking code
param.dialogReference: Specify the field that contains the unique identifier for the input cover factor dataset for the closing year. For rasters, this field is typically VALUE. For feature classes/shapefiles, this field is dependent on the creation of the dataset.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_A
param.displayname: P-factor for Year A: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) rasterfor the opening year.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_B
param.displayname: P-factor for Year B: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) rasterfor the closing year.

tool.summary:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) approach for using different factor layers and then compares the difference in soil loss between the opening and closing years. This tool requires the following inputs:

  • Scenario folders: Generated by the Preprocess datatool which runs consistency checks and reconditions the DEM if required.

  • Rainfall erosivity

  • Soil erodibility: Can be created using global or local data, this dataset must contain K-factor values.

  • Cover factor: Can be created using global or local data, this dataset must contain C-factor values.

  • Support factor: Optional parameter, dataset must contain P-factor values.

idCitation.resTitle: Calculate soil loss accounts using different factor layers

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) approach for using different factor layers and then compares the difference in soil loss between the opening and closing years. This tool requires the following inputs:

  • Scenario folders: Generated by the Preprocess datatool which runs consistency checks and reconditions the DEM if required.

  • Rainfall erosivity

  • Soil erodibility: Can be created using global or local data, this dataset must contain K-factor values.

  • Cover factor: Can be created using global or local data, this dataset must contain C-factor values.

  • Support factor: Optional parameter, dataset must contain P-factor values.
